name: AFFIRM HUMAN RIGHTS
goal:
Assisting people facing migration with information, support & resources, ensuring they have the basics for life and protection of their Human Rights.

Affirm Human Rights is an NGO that assists migrants with information and resources essential for them to sustain themselves and ensure their basic Human Rights are maintained.

People now move across borders more frequently sometimes due to choice but at times they are forced due to conflict and disaster.

Affirm Human Rights aims to help migrants with information, advice, assistance and resources.

Affirm Human Rights makes referrals where necessary and works with partners to ensure migrants get direct access to essential services and experts.

Affirm Human Rights takes direct action to protect those who are vulnerable and often undocumented such as minors, the disabled, asylum applicants, victims of trafficking and abuse, the homeless and those in need of humanitarian aid.

Affirm Human Rights stands to enable migrants to integrate into the receiving community more easily and where they are asked to leave reintegrate in their home countries with dignity and support.

Affirm Human Rights stands as a commentator on global and government policies to ensure international obligations for protection of migrants is maintained.
euInitiatives:
Developments following the UK BREXIT

Stockholm Programme

EU-wide laws (directives) have already been introduced to standardise admission and residence rules for the following categories of non-EU citizens wishing to come to an EU country to work or study:

Highly-qualified workers (EU Blue Card scheme)
Students
Unpaid trainees, school pupils and voluntary workers
Researchers

EU-wide admission and residence rules for other categories of non-EU citizens are under discussion, following proposals made in the EU's 2005 Policy Plan on Legal Migration and reaffirmed in the Stockholm Programme.

These include EU directives on:
seasonal workers;
employees of multinational companies who wish to move to a branch office in an EU country.

and more
